articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Peruvian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Peruvian President
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Alan Garcia Perez, president of Peru, on Wednesday on the occasion of the 189th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the president of Peru greater success in his work for the economic and cultural development of the country and the promotion of the people's welfare and expressed belief that the relations between the two countries would continue to develop in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Vietnam Farmers' Union Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Vietnam Farmers' Union Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Vietnam Farmers' Union led by Chairman of its Central Committee Nguyen Quoc Cuong at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 The chairman said that he was deeply impressed to see the Korean people pushing ahead with the building of a thriving nation during the visit to the DPRK.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would register greater success under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Gift from Vietnam Farmers' Union Chairman
articles.content:
Gift from Vietnam Farmers' Union Chairman
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Nguyen Quoc Cuong, chairman of the Central Committee of the Vietnam Farmers' Union, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The chairman handed over the gift to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Korean Victory Day Observed by Foreign Crews
articles.content:
Korean Victory Day Observed by Foreign Crews
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held by foreign crew members at Chongjin and Nampho ports on July 26 and 27 on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Prior to the meeting held at Nampho Port its participants placed a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung in the city and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Present at the meetings were the captains and crew members of Panamanian-flagged ships "Trade Fortune" and "Ling Hai", Saint Vincent and Grenadines-flagged ship "Venuzs" and a Cambodian-flagged ship.
					
					 The speakers at the meeting said that the army and people of the DPRK beat back the armed invasion launched by the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and defended the country under the leadership of the President in the 1950s.
					
					 They referred to the shining victory won by the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War thanks to the Juche-oriented military idea, strategy and tactics and outstanding commanding art of the President.
					
					 They praised the DPRK for foiling the moves of the imperialists to unleash a new war and making a great contribution to defending the world peace under the wise leadership of General Secretary
						 Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They expressed belief that the Korean people would successfully build a thriving socialist nation of Juche under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting at Nampho Port.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Russians Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Russians Held
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- A friendly gathering with Russians took place at the Rungrado Recreation Ground on Wednesday on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the publication of the DPRK-Russia joint declaration.
					 Present there were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairwoman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned and Alexander Matsegora, charge d'affaires a.i., and staff members of the Russian embassy here.
					
					 First an art performance was given by the State Folk Art Troupe.
					
					 The performers presented female solo "We Always Remember All Sorts of Hardships Undergone by the Leader" and mixed vocal duet "Hen Pheasant Ballad", song and dance "Song of Days of the Week" and other numbers. They also presented Russian songs including "Lamp" and "Kalinka".
					
					 The Russians joined in the performance.
					
					 Then followed multifarious sports and amusement games.
					
					 Divided into "friendship" team and "solidarity" team, they played volleyball, running with two balls in arms and one ball pressed against each other's foreheads, a yut-game, etc., spending joyful time.
					
					 They talked to each other, deepening the friendship.

articles.title: Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed
articles.content:
Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with staff members of the Cuban embassy here took place at DPRK-Cuba Friendship Moranbong Secondary School No. 1 on Wednesday on the occasion of the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 Present there on invitation were Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Galego Montano and staff members of the embassy.
					
					 On hand were Mun Jae Chol, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and concurrently vice-chairman of the DPRK-Cuba Solidarity Committee, officials concerned and teachers and students of the school.
					
					 The participants of the meeting looked around the "room of friendship with Cuba" and classroom of "Jose Marti Class" and educational facilities of the school.
					
					 They appreciated an art performance given by students and talked about contributing to the development of the relations between the two countries, deepening the sentiment of friendship.

articles.title: Pillage of Korean Cultural Assets by US Imperialists
articles.content:
Pillage of Korean Cultural Assets by US Imperialists
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- More than 130 pieces of historic relics that belong to the Ri Dynasty were put up at an auction in Michigan, United States, some time ago.
					 The relics, including art works, furniture and ornaments, are what the U.S. imperialists took away from the Deogsu Royal Palace in Seoul during the past Korean War.
					
					 The articles for sale at auction were just a small part of their loot.
					
					 A large number of Korean cultural assets such as Koryo celadon, metal craftworks and furniture are on display at museums and art galleries in Washington, New York and many other cities of the Unites States.
					
					 According to data available, the U.S. imperialists destroyed or took away tens of thousands of cultural assets, with some 6,700 pieces of priceless historic relics included, from history museums of Korea during their temporary occupation of the northern part of Korea. 
					
					 They despoiled the Korean Central History Museum of several thousand pieces of cultural assets, the Myohyangsan History Museum of Buddhist relics, including several hundred Buddhist images, and craftworks and the Haeju History Museum of more than a hundred pieces of relics.
					
					 They also robbed Yongmyong Temple on Moran Hill, Songbul Temple on Mt. Jongbang and other Buddhist temples of many historic relics, including gold statues of Buddha and Buddhist images. 
					
					 Besides, they pillaged several hundred ancient tombs in the area of Jongbaek-dong, Rangnang District, Pyongyang, of thousands of relics and ransacked even houses of their heirlooms.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists destroyed, seized and burnt up many cultural assets in the southern part of Korea, too. The historic relics they snatched from the History Museum of the Kyongbok Palace and the Art Gallery of the Deogsu Palace in Seoul total more than 7,200. 
					
					 The United States is obliged to send all the loot back to Korea without condition and apologize and compensate to the Korean people for the enormous spiritual, cultural and material damages and losses it inflicted upon them.

articles.title: Removal of Source of War Urged
articles.content:
Removal of Source of War Urged
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- To remove the source of war and ensure peace becomes the urgent task under the present situation in which the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces are escalating their moves to ignite a war against the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 At present there is not any legal guarantee for peace and security of the Korean Peninsula. The Korean Armistice Agreement has already been reduced to a mere scrap of paper due to the maneuvers of the bellicose forces at home and abroad threatening peace and security of the peninsula. All the inter-Korean agreements on removing the military confrontation and tension were nullified and the north-south dialogue and cooperation, which had been kept even in the era of confrontation, were suspended under the present south Korean conservative authorities' policy of stamping out the inter-Korean declarations. This is the aftermath of the deliberate and premeditated maneuvers on the part of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces seeking to provoke the second Korean war at any cost.
					
					 Any problem can not be correctly solved without ensuring peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The main source of disturbing peace on the peninsula is the U.S. constant hostile policy toward the DPRK. The U.S. should stop at once its criminal hostile policy that escalates the military confrontation and tension on the peninsula and brings the danger of a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The unstable armistice system lasting more than half a century becomes a source of military tension and possible outbreak of war. The Armistice Agreement should be replaced with a peace treaty to establish a durable peacekeeping mechanism. 
					
					 Large-scale joint military exercises and arms buildup, being ceaselessly conducted in south Korea, are the most realistic danger. The reckless anti-DPRK joint military exercises and arms buildup in south Korea, which pose military threat to the fellow countrymen and bring the danger of a war, should be discontinued unconditionally.

articles.title: Maneuvers Aimed at Making Triangular Alliance
articles.content:
Maneuvers Aimed at Making Triangular Alliance
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. warlike forces are busy with the criminal moves to knock into shape a triangular military alliance through the on-going war exercises. This is clearly evidenced by the fact that officers of the Japan Maritime "Self-Defence Force" were invited to participate in the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises now under way in the East Sea of Korea. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The triangular military alliance grouping the U.S., Japan and south Korea actually exists and is now operational. Herein lies more dangerous and serious nature of the on-going joint naval maneuvers.
					
					 The preparations for the formation of the above-said military alliance had been pushed forward since the era of the Cold War. This alliance helps the U.S. realize its wild ambition to dominate the world and Japan put its scenario for reinvasion into practice in order to realize its old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" as "a leader" of Asia. This alliance is now becoming a reality after going through a full-fledged phase. 
					
					 By rounding off the formation of the military alliance the U.S. seeks to legally use Japan and south Korea as shock brigades for carrying out its strategy for invading the DPRK. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the Japanese reactionaries are working hard to make a breakthrough towards realizing their wild ambition for overseas expansion, pursuant to the U.S. strategy for invading the DPRK. The exceptional zeal shown by Japan in the efforts to knock the military alliance into shape is aimed to please its American master and increase the SDF's operational function for overseas aggression under its backing and patronage. 
					
					 This time the U.S. let officers of the MSDF to participate in the joint naval military exercises in the East Sea of Korea under the cloaks of "observers" and "visitors." But it wants to openly plug troops of the SDF into the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises in the future with the above-said case as a precedent.
					
					 This is precisely what the U.S. seeks. 
					
					 The hostile forces would be well advised to behave themselves, cogitating about the serious consequences to be entailed by the above-said moves.

articles.title: Korean Victory Day Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Korean Victory Day Observed in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- A meeting, a film show and an explanation meeting took place in Bulgaria, Russia and Indonesia on July 21 and 22 to mark the 57th anniversary of the victorious Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present at the events were personages of different circles and popular masses in those countries.
					
					 Speakers at the events noted with high appreciation that the young DPRK worked the miracle of world historic significance by repelling the aggression of the U.S. imperialists, who boasted of being "the strongest", under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, the great strategist and iron-willed commander.
					
					 They stressed that peace and security of not only the Korean Peninsula but the rest of the world have been protected under the Songun leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il who is brilliantly carrying forward to completion the cause of the President.
					
					 Saying that the Korean people are successfully advancing the socialist cause despite the constant anti-DPRK moves of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities, they reiterated full support and solidarity with the Korean people's just cause.
					
					 A message of greetings to  Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Bulgaria.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Cause Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Supported
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Organizations and personages of different countries made public statements on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK in its statement on July 23 noted that the three-year Korean War in the 1950s ended up with victory of the army and people of the DPRK who made heroic struggle, closely rallied around President Kim Il Sung and the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					Friends of Korea in Russia together with the world progressives fully support all the just and principled lines General Secretary Kim Jong Il set forth and is carrying into practice to defend the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation and achieve the peace and reunification of Korea, the statement stressed.
					
					 Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, in the statement on July 22 expressed firm belief that the army and people of the DPRK would register greater successes in their efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation and achieve national reunification, extending solidarity to the Korean people who have made history of victory in every struggle against imperialism and the U.S.
					
					 Oskar Molleby, chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, in the statement issued on the same day condemned the U.S. for getting evermore pronounced in the scheme to stifle the DPRK instead of replacing the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty.

articles.title: US Human Rights Abuses Blasted in Ethiopia
articles.content:
US Human Rights Abuses Blasted in Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea published its bulletin No. 12 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The bulletin in an article recalled that the U.S. likes to publish a lengthy "human rights report" every year to pull up other countries. It accused the U.S. of releasing "a human rights report" this year, too, to attack other countries.
					
					 The bulletin cited facts to prove that even the elementary rights of the black people and inhabitants of minorities are being violated and they are subject to all sorts of contempt due to extreme racial discrimination in the United States and prisoners are maltreated and put to torture in the prison of the Guantanamo Base and other detention camps and prisons in various other countries and regions of the world at the tacit connivance of the U.S. administration and under its prodding. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 All facts prove that the U.S. is, indeed, the worst human right abuser in the world.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to repent of its human rights issue before behaving as if it were "a human rights judge."

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- One day in mid-March Juche 40 (1951), President Kim Il Sung worked at his office till late at night and left for a unit of the Korean People's Army on the west coast by car that night.
					 When the car reached the top of a low pass, he told the driver to stop the car.
					
					 Looking at his watch, he said it was too early to visit the unit and suggested waiting there until the soldiers' getting up from bed. 
					
					 He then got off the car and had a slow walk, exposed to cold wind from the sea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia concierto de Coro Estatal Benemerito
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia concierto de Coro Estatal Benemerito
Pyongyang, 28 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio el concierto del Coro Estatal Benemerito dedicado al 57o aniversario del gran triunfo del pueblo coreano en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (1950-1953).
					El Dirigente respondio cordialmente a las entusiastas aclamaciones de los espectadores y les dio calurosa felicitacion por el dia del triunfo.
					
					En la escena se pusieron diversas piezas como el coro masculino "Himno al Mariscal Kim Il Sung", "Es mejor nuestro General" y "27 de Julio, dia de la victoria", las canciones de tiempo de guerra en serie "Cancion de la defensa de la patria", "A la batalla decisiva" y "Mi cancion en la trinchera", la musica orquestal y coro masculino "Loma Mungyong", el coro masculino "?Donde esta el querido General?", el solo y coro masculinos "Defendemos la seguridad fisica del General" y "Por la unica patria", el coro masculino "Ordene, Lider" y "Desfile militar por la victoria".
					
					Los ejecutantes cantaron en tono patetico los orgullosos meritos del EPC y el pueblo coreano que pusieron de pleno manifiesto la dignidad y el temperamento de la Corea heroica al defender honrosamente la libertad y la independencia de la patria bajo la sabia direccion del Partido y el Lider derrotando a las fuerzas aliadas imperialistas acaudilladas por los yanquis.
					
					Igualmente, demostraron bien la ferrea conviccion y voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea de llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada en el monte Paektu siguiendo al Dirigente.
					
					Ademas, manifestaron bien el temperamento del ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu de defender como una muralla de acero la patria socialista frustrando despiadadamente con el poderio del Songun a los imperialistas norteamericanos y sus lacayos que se entregan con frenesi a las maniobras de provocacion de nueva guerra, si estos se atreven a invadir una pulgada de la tierra, el mar y el cielo de nuestra sagrada patria.
					
					Muy satisfecho de que el Coro Estatal Benemerito haya ofrecido esta magnifica funcion de gran valor ideo-artistico en que se palpitan la conviccion y voluntad de Corea y el espiritu revolucionario de los militares, el Dirigente evaluo altamente el exito de la funcion y dio agradecimiento a todos los creadores y artistas. 
					
					El triunfo historico en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria fue un evento nacional, que salvaguardo otra vez el destino de la patria que se hallaba en la crisis de vida o muerte, y fue una victoria orgullosa que confirmo en la realidad que ninguna fuerza puede detener el avance de nuestro pueblo hacia la soberania, la independencia y el socialismo, dijo el Dirigente y agrego que las proezas del Presidente Kim Il Sung en el logro del triunfo en la guerra antiyanqui se registraran eternamente en los anales de la patria. 
					
					Expreso su gran esperanza y conviccion de que los artistas del Coro Estatal Benemerito estimularan mucho al ejercito y el pueblo a la nueva victoria mediante sus actividades artisticas revolucionarias y combativas como aquellos dias de la gran Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria cuando llamaban a los soldados a la creacion de meritos ofreciendo funciones en las cotas en combate bajo las lluvias de balas.
					
					Le acompanaron en verla Choe Yong Rim, primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC; el vicemariscal del EPC Kim Yong Chun, vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares; Jang Song Thaek, vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC; Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kuk Thae y Kim Ki Nam, secretarios del CC del PTC; el general de ejercito del EPC Kim Jong Gak, miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC; el general de ejercito del EPC Ri Yong Ho, jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC; Ju Sang Song, miembro del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo; y otros miembros directivos del ejercito y los organos de las fuerzas armadas y los cuadros directivos del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje al presidente peruano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje al presidente peruano
Pyongyang, 28 de julio (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este miercoles un mensaje al presidente de la Republica Peruana, Alan Garcia Perez, para felicitarle por el 189o aniversario de la independencia de este pais sudamericano.
					 El remitente desea de todo corazon al destinatario mayores exitos en sus labores para el desarrollo economico y cultural del pais y el bienestar del pueblo y expresa conviccion de que las relaciones entre ambos paises seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose bajo el ideal de la independencia, la paz y la amistad.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena el intento de fortalecer alianza militar tripartita
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena el intento de fortalecer alianza militar tripartita
Pyongyang, 28 de julio (ATCC) -- En un comentario individual del dia 28 el periodico Rodong Sinmun condena a las fuerzas belicistas norteamericanas que maniobran freneticamente para formar la criminal alianza militar tripartita aprovechando el ejercicio militar conjunto que libran en el Mar Este de Corea junto con los titeres surcoreanos.
					  Los yanquis incorporan a los oficiales de las "Fuerzas Maritimas de Autodefensa" de Japon en ese simulacro, lo cual es un simple ejemplo.
					
					 Senala el comentarista y continua:
					
					 La alianza militar tripartita existe realmente y se pone en funcion.
					
					  He aqui precisamente la mayor peligrosidad y gravedad del presente ejercicio maritimo.
					
					  El establecimiento de esta alianza, que ha venido impulsandose desde el periodo de la guerra fria, demuestra la ambicion de EE.UU. de dominar el mundo y el intento de nueva agresion de Japon de realizar su antiguo sueno de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental" "senoreandose" de Asia.
					
					  EE.UU. intenta completarla para usar de manera legitima a Japon y el Sur de corea como brigada de choque en la realizacion de su estrategia de agresion a Corea.
					
					  Por otra parte, los reaccionarios japoneses tienden a abrir brecha de la realizacion de su ambicion de expansion a ultramar adhiriendose a tal estrategia de EE.UU.
					
					  Ellos se esfuerzan activamente por el establecimiento de la alianza militar tripartita a fin de adular a su amo norteamericano y elevar la capacidad de operacion de agresion a ultramar de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" bajo el amparo de los yanquis.
					
					  Esta vez, el pais isleno participa en el presente simulacro a los oficiales de las "fuerzas maritimas de Autodefensa" con la mascara de "observador" y "visita", pero, en el futuro trata de enviar abiertamente a sus fuerzas armadas a los ejercicios miliares conjuntos EE.UU.-Sur de Corea.
					
					  Esto es el objetivo de EE.UU.
					
					  Las fuerzas hostiles deben actuar con prudencia dandose clara cuenta de las graves consecuencias que emanen del establecimiento de la alianza militar tripartita de caracter agresivo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun insiste en eliminar la fuente de guerra
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun insiste en eliminar la fuente de guerra
Pyongyang, 28 de julio (ATCC) -- En la actualidad, se tornan cada dia mas graves las maniobras de Estados Unidos y los titeres surcoreanos tendentes a provocar la guerra de agresion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. Tal situacion presenta como la tarea apremiante eliminar la fuente de la guerra y preservar la paz. 
					 Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este miercoles y continua:
					
					 Ahora, no hay ninguna garantia legal capaz de asegurar la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					 Debido a los tejemanejes de las fuerzas belicistas internas y externas que amenazan la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana, el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea ya se convirtio en letra muerta.  
					
					Ademas, las maniobras de las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas destinadas a exterminar las declaraciones conjuntas Norte-Sur invalidaron todos los acuerdos intercoreanos aprobados para eliminar la confrontacion militar y aliviar la tension y dejaron en suspension el dialogo y la cooperacion entre ambas partes que se realizaban aun en la epoca de enfrentamiento.
					
					 Todo esto se debe a las intrigas premeditadas de EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos de desatar a toda costa la segunda guerra coreana.
					
					 Si no se aseguran la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana, tampoco puede resolver cualquier problema. 
					
					La causa raigal de la perturbacion de la paz de la Peninsula Coreana es la invariable politica hostil de EE.UU. contra la RPDC.
					
					  El imperio debe poner de inmediato fin a esta politica criminal que agrava el enfrentamiento militar y la tension en la Peninsula Coreana y acarrea el peligro de la guerra de agresion a la RPDC.
					
					  El inestable sistema de armisticio de mas de medio siglo deviene la causa de la tension militar y del estallido de la guerra. Es preciso sustituir el Acuerdo de Armisticio por el convenio de paz y establecer el sistema de la paz duradera.
					
					  Deben dar toque final a los incesantes ejercicios militares conjuntos de gran envergadura y el aumento de las fuerzas armadas, que se desarrollan en el Sur de Corea amenazando militarmente a los connacionales y creando el peligro de guerra.
